result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ashley C Berry in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Ashley C Berry. Attorney Jason Daane in court. Attorney JJ Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Renner is requesting another status date. Record by Attorney Renner. Court addresses Attorney Renner. Victim present and makes statement. Victim would like matter resolved. Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:04pm Court in session

Defendant Ashley Berry present in court, in custody via video with attorney Jason Daane. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Victims family is present in court but does not wish to make statement. Court will set arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley C Berry
Current: 821 10th Ave N, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 1609 Bayliss Ave, Beloit, WI 53511
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH FAMILY OF VICTIM - A.A.J. dob 9-2-1990 OR RESIDENCE. WITNESS NICOLE LARSON OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
